Message.Title: Google is trying to kill both Apple and Facebook with Android and Google+...
Message.Msg: Marissa Mayer is a really smart lady who actually was the key person of the successful of Google(she designed the clean and beautiful home page of Google which directly led Google to success). She knows that MSFT is trying stealing search market from Yahoo instead of Google with its search deal. Facebook would need the search technology and patent from Yahoo to fight with Google. MSFT is out and dying due to its greedy. Apple wants to build its own search engine, however, it might takes years to archive it. Before it could do it, Android had already killed IPhone and iPad. So Apple needs search too and needs search immediately to fight Google. Both Facebook and Apple has the ambition to fight Google since Google is trying to kill both of them.

Topic.Title: But by not supporting the $20 price with buybacks Marissa raped YHOO longs letting all...

Message.Msg: 1. Marissa isn't enamored with the day-to-day stock price movement and you simply can't be pleased...stock falls to $19.50 its her fault and now 5yr highs its still her fault. Many companies have been destroyed thinking short-term vs. long-term. I'm fairly confident a HUGE part of this rise is due towards a buyback. If you own the $20's then you're not a shareholder anyway as you only purchased the RIGHT to buy it at $20. If you are a shareholder then you own stock so why buy the options? Some tips 1. Never own the front month 2. Look for a return of 3:1 3. Cut losses at 50% 4. Never let an option position be more than 5% of your portfolio. 5. Only invest what you're willing to lose by owning the stock. If you only want to lose $1000 then you only put on an option trade worth $1000. I have a list somewhere but those are off the top of my head. 2. Its unlikely she could have stopped it from being pinned at $20 as Market Makers, in the business to create a market, will in the event of creating that call, will go long the stock and long the put to make it delta neutral. The more it gets above $20 they more shares they unload and vice versa underneath $20. Go to the website OptionAnimal and type in Option Pinning as it has a very good article. I would give the link but Yahoo won't let me. Unless I get a thank you no need to reply besides have you seen the day Netflix is having:)hahahahaha

Message.Title: March 31st YHOO to announce renewal or alternate plan for search with much better deal than they had with MSFT!
Message.Msg: YHOO has a large buyback program in place with a $3 billion commitment from management. With about $7.7 billion in cash on the balance sheet (net of $2.5 billion in cash to be paid in taxes for Alibaba transaction), we believe the company can buy back 11- 12% of diluted shares outstanding; and 3) Update on RPS guarantee negotiations with MSFT. The guarantee ends on March 31, 2013, and YHOO has to announce a renewal or an alternate plan for monetization. On the 3Q12 results call, management indicated that the annual make good from MSFT is about $100 million.

Message.Title: B. Rileyâs Sameet Sinha reiterates a Buy rating onYahoo! and a $26 price target
Message.Msg: Expectations are not very high for YHOOâs results and we believe the focus will be on three items: 1) Further insight into Marissa Mayerâs turnaround plan for the company. Marissa has her work cut out from HR issues to products, which will take several quarters to work through and a roadmap would be helpful; 2) Magnitude of share buybacks. YHOO has a large buyback program in place with a $3 billion commitment from management. With about $7.7 billion in cash on the balance sheet (net of $2.5 billion in cash to be paid in taxes for Alibaba transaction), we believe the company can buy back 11- 12% of diluted shares outstanding; and 3) Update on RPS guarantee negotiations with MSFT. The guarantee ends on March 31, 2013, and YHOO has to announce a renewal or an alternate plan for monetization. On the 3Q12 results call, management indicated that the annual make good from MSFT is about $100 million.

Topic.Title: B. Rileyâs Sameet Sinha reiterates a Buy rating onYahoo! and a $26 price target

Message.Msg: hotmodeltestid122 â¢ Jan 22, 2013 1:20 AM 1 users liked this posts users disliked this posts 3 Reply . I don't recall it being anything less than the 28th, going back to late November/December, as I've been checking it for awhile now. That being said, it really doesn't matter, as Alibaba's revenue numbers have never been included in the quarterly earnings. They shove it in the annual report but it has zero impact on Yahoo's earnings. Earnings themselves I'm guessing are going to be boring as Yahoo is quite predictable...220M+ operating income in Q4, revenue of 1.2-1.3B maybe(flat), less than 5% growth, negative in some sectors and probably bought back $500M-$1B worth of shares judging by the pop in share price. Its possible they spent $1.5B+ which would remove 100M shares, giving the stock an inflated 10% pop. Oh and I expect Yahoo's cash to fall billions either in this quarters earnings or next quarter to cover the Alibaba taxes and stock buyback. On a side note, what is the breakdown to get your "additional $100M" figure? I figure its easier to ask then go digging for Alibaba's revenues times Yahoo's stake. thanks! ***No wonder you make so many topics in my honor, sadly I heard Coldone got AIDS from taking advantage of a monkey and died. Message.Title: Post Here If You Feel Good!
Message.Msg: :) No matter who you are, you must admit that YHOO has been kind to shareholders for the past... well, couple of months really. Today was a good day for the YHOO longs. :) Peeled off some new 52-week highs and closed higher than the previous 52-week high. Finally, right!? While you're here, tell me how you feel about Monday! It's a little scary. Kinda makes ya think "Apple" or "Netflix", eh? None of us really know what's gonna happen to the price, but at least we'll (hopefully) finally get some strong and specific details out of Marissa. If she shows up on time, that is. ;)

Message.Title: stock movement
Message.Msg: i have never witnessed so many cheerleaders in skirts than the bozos who post on this site for this stock. perhaps the most immature and least professional of any MB in existence. why not bring something of substance to the table rather than just BS, future stock p[rice, hype, buyout rumors, etc. bring on professional thoughts to which people can respond and a discussion could ensue. probably asking for too much from you ladies, i figure.

Message.Title: Marissa is not running for the bottom
Message.Msg: This is my realization this week. I thought that yahoo was going to bottom feed the huge internet. This approach, if successful, would have yielded a $50b market cap in 36 months. But it seems that Marissa is choosing a riskier road to figth to the top. If successful this could be a $200b in 5 years. hummm. riskier indeed.

Topic.Title: Marissa is not running for the bottom

Message.Msg: Watchout for revenues. Marissa can control earnings with the huge cash stash she has. If earnings are better than expected, without her levering by buying stock, this is rocket. If she uses buybacks to reach the earning, then is smokes and mirrors.

Topic.Title: stock movement

Message.Msg: Gimme a Y! Gimme an A! ... First of all, your post doesn't really add much more substance than the mindless cheerleading. But aside that, I'd love to talk about something of substance. What'cha think we should talk about? Here's a serious question for you: Do you think that YHOO is fundamentally undervalued, especially in relation to its peers, based on the value of cash on hand in addition to the various international investments and core "media/products" business? What do you think, after the dust has settled from all of the scheduled buybacks, YHOO is worth on a per share basis?

Message.Title: Monday Earnings mean good earnings
Message.Msg: Yhoo changed their earning date for an unknown reason. But after changing it, they can choose any day of the week. Why Monday? Typically if bad, move it to Thursday/Friday to get a respite, if Good move it to Monday/Tuesday to get a run! There is always a reason with Marissa.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Anxious to End Microsoft Search Deal

Message.Msg: It's so easy to see the superiority of Google search over Bing (aka: Yahoo search). There's no comparison. Unless Microsoft commits to improving Bing in a MAJOR way IMMEDIATELY, Marissa should tell them to take a walk. I (and I would say, a lot of people) go to Yahoo for their other features (e.g. Finance) and go to Google for search.
